body:
# Memory Conversion

Quick and easy conversion between memory values.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     memory_conversion:
       github: dscottboggs/memory_conversion
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "memory_conversion"

1.terabyte.to_kilobits
```

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/dscottboggs/memory_conversion/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Scott Boggs](https://github.com/dscottboggs) - creator and maintainer

instance_methods.name: to_storage_bits
instance_methods.doc:
Convert this number of bits to the equivalent number of
bits. This uses the metric used by storage manufacturers
to inflate their capacity values, by using powers of 10 instead of powers
of two.
instance_methods.summary: Convert this number of bits to the equivalent number of bits.

instance_methods.name: to_storage_bytes
instance_methods.doc: Convert to storage bits and then divide by 8.

instance_methods.name: bit
instance_methods.doc:
Return a MemoryConversion::Bits which has this number of bits.

```
one_bit = 1.bit # => MemoryConversion::Bits(@value=1)
one_bit.to_bits # => 1_f64
```
instance_methods.summary: Return a MemoryConversion::Bits which has this number of bits.

instance_methods.name: bits
instance_methods.doc:
Return a MemoryConversion::Bits which has this number of bits.

```
one_bit = 1.bit # => MemoryConversion::Bits(@value=1)
one_bit.to_bits # => 1_f64
```
instance_methods.summary: Return a MemoryConversion::Bits which has this number of bits.

instance_methods.name: byte

Return a MemoryConversion::Bytes which has this number of bytes.

```
one_byte = 1.byte # => MemoryConversion::Bytes(@value=1)
one_byte.to_bytes # => 1_f64
```
instance_methods.summary: Return a MemoryConversion::Bytes which has this number of bytes.

instance_methods.name: exabit
instance_methods.doc:
Return a MemoryConversion::Bits which has this number of Exabits.

```
one_exabit = 1.exabit # => MemoryConversion::Bits(@value=0)
one_exabit.to_bits # => 0_f64
```
instance_methods.summary: Return a MemoryConversion::Bits which has this number of Exabits.
